name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Today was Super Tuesday, where 16 states and one territory got together to hold an intervention for Nikki Haley.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Yesterday in the New Yorker , President Biden said he will beat former President Trump and added, ‘I’m the only one who has ever beat him.’ Well that’s true, unless you count E. Jean Carroll, Letitia James, COVID, the free market, and ramps.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: The Trump White House would give staffers Xanax and speed without prescriptions. And one patient kept asking them, ‘Is there such a thing as reverse Viagra?’

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: According to a new survey, at least half of parents keep a pregnancy test or ultrasound image of their child as a keepsake. But be careful, because the Alabama Supreme Court now considers both of those things a person.

name: Seth Meyers
monologue: Photographers in Hawaii recently captured images of two male humpback whales having sex, in case you were wondering why Mike Pence is trying to shut down the beach.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Taylor Swift told her 282 million Instagram followers to vote in Tuesday’s primaries but refrained from endorsing any particular political candidates or parties. We haven’t seen a celebrity take a stance this boldly neutral since Rob Lowe went to an NFL game with hat that said ‘NFL.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: In a recent poll, almost 50 percent of respondents said they believe it is likely Democrats will replace Biden with another candidate before the election. No! No, they won’t. It’s Trump versus Biden, stop making up election fanfic. ‘Ooh, what if Tom Brady comes out of retirement and runs for president? He can make Gronk Secretary of Gronking. And then they kiss.'

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: One 28-year-old told reporters he loves Biden, quote, ‘And I feel like I’m the only one… Does anybody care that I exist?’ You’re not the only one who feels that way. In fact it’s Nikki Haley’s campaign slogan.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: I just have one more fella I have to catch up to

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: $197 billion? Okay poor-y. You know, don’t even show up to this year’s Eyes Wide Shut party. Nobody wants to spank you in the gazebo.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Congrats, Jeff. It’s the second list you’ve toped this year after Worlds Most Divorced Man.

name: Stephen Colbert
monologue: Well, that’s what Miami gets for holding its annual running of the Chads.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Today is Super Tuesday, which is exciting because that means tomorrow is Super Humpday.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Today, Facebook and Instagram experienced a massive outage and went down for over half a million people. All day people were like, ‘If I can’t post a photo of me voting, then what was the point?'

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Jeff Bezos said, “It’s good to be back on top.

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: Krysten Sinema is stepping down to spend more time with her family: Goldman and Sachs.

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: I personally actually like that Krysten Sinema taught everyone a very important lesson. That you can’t assume someone’s beliefs based on how they dress. She came on the scene like, ‘Hey everyone, look at my pink tutu! You know I’m liberal!’ And then she walked into the Senate like, “Private equity gets everything! Drill those orphans for oil!'

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: Wow, it took the most cutting edge technology to get Donald Trump to hang out with six Black guys.

name: Ronny Chieng
monologue: [On the Biden administration’s campaign against so-called “shrinkflation” of everyday products] “So you really think Americans will go to the polls to protect democracy? Hell no. But if you promise to protect the number of sprinkles on their Pop-Tarts? Record turnout. “ Ronny Chieng
